title: How to Open APKG Files on Mobile or Desktop

steps.title: Download and install Anki if you don't have it.
steps.content: Download and install Anki if you don't have it. If you're on a Mac, Windows, Linux, Android, or iPhone, you can use Anki. To download, go to https://apps.ankiweb.net/ and click Download or search for the app in the App Store (AnkiMobile) or Google Play Store (AnkiDroid). Double-click to open the installed file and follow the on-screen instructions to install the application.

steps.title: Open File Explorer (Windows) or Finder (Mac).
steps.content: Open File Explorer (Windows) or Finder (Mac). Press the Windows Key + E to open File Explorer, or click the two-toned smiley face icon on your Mac's Dock, which is usually at the bottom of the screen.

steps.title: Double-click the APKG file.
steps.content: Double-click the APKG file. If Anki doesn't automatically open the APKG file, you need to right-click on the file, then select Open With > Anki . [1] X Research source

steps.title: Open AnkiDroid.
steps.content: Open AnkiDroid. This app looks like a grey/black rectangle with a blue star on it that you'll find on one of your Home screens, in the app drawer, or by searching. [2] X Research source Tap OK and Allow to give the app permission to access your storage.

steps.title: Tap ⋮.
steps.content: Tap ⋮ . It's in the top right corner of your screen.

steps.title: Tap Import.
steps.content: Tap Import . You'll see this option near the bottom of the menu. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Navigate to and tap your APKG file.
steps.content: Navigate to and tap your APKG file. You can tap the three-line menu icon if you want to access a different file location. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Tap ADD.
steps.content: Tap ADD . The APKG file will be added to your flashcard collections, which may take a while depending on how many files are inside the APKG file.
